Sentencas: A microwave irradiation process is used to deposit Cu nanoparticles on the Ni/YSZ anode of an electrolyte-supported solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC).
Titulo: Preparation of Cu-Ni/YSZ solid oxide fuel cell anodes using microwave irradiation

Sentencas: The reaction time in the microwave is only 15 s for the deposition of 6 wt% Cu (with respect to Ni) from a solution of Cu(NO3)(2 center dot)3H(2)O and ethylene glycol (FlOCH(2)CH(2)OH).
Titulo: Preparation of Cu-Ni/YSZ solid oxide fuel cell anodes using microwave irradiation

Sentencas: The morphology of the deposited Cu particles is spherical and the average size of the particles is less than 100 nm.
Titulo: Preparation of Cu-Ni/YSZ solid oxide fuel cell anodes using microwave irradiation

Sentencas: The electrochemical performance of the microwave Cu-coated Ni/YSZ anodes is tested in dry H-2 and dry CH4 at 1073 K. and the anodes are characterized with scanning electron microscopy, electrochemical impedance spectroscopy, and temperature-programmed oxidation.
Titulo: Preparation of Cu-Ni/YSZ solid oxide fuel cell anodes using microwave irradiation

Sentencas: The results indicate that preparation of the anodes by the microwave technique produces similar performance trend as those reported for Cu-Ni/YSZ/CeO2 anodes prepared by impregnation.
Titulo: Preparation of Cu-Ni/YSZ solid oxide fuel cell anodes using microwave irradiation

Sentencas: Specifically, less carbon is formed on the Cu-Ni/YSZ than on conventional Ni/YSZ anodes when exposed to dry methane and the carbon that does form is more reactive.
Titulo: Preparation of Cu-Ni/YSZ solid oxide fuel cell anodes using microwave irradiation
Preparation of Cu-Ni/YSZ solid oxide fuel cell anodes using microwave irradiation
Preparation of Cu-Ni/YSZ solid oxide fuel cell anodes using microwave irradiation
